subject: Re: Good Box...Bad Box
author: Steve Hultay
full_text:
The only thing i lost was a switch for the ceiling fan so far, so i 
think that's a good ratio.  Lights flicker and they shut stuff off 
and turn it back on, but nothing really breaks.  I really can't 
blame them anyway, it was probably just a coincidence.  My house is 
200 years old and has only 60 amp service.

-Steve H.


--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, "Frank Sumption" <franks-boxes@...> 
wrote:
>
> This stuff can get kinda weird. I had another box request recieved 
a via 
> snail mail, asking for a "digital box", I don't know where they 
got idea. 
> They also sent along a series of CDs that were excepts of 
channeled material 
> talking about "the telephone to the dead". I thought I would at 
least see 
> what was on it, so started listening to the first CD, the dog went 
totally 
> bonkers, running around the house barking and howling! I stpped 
the play 
> back, and put the stuff back in it's box to ship back.
> 
> The little that I did hear, as I kinda scanned through the first 
track, was 
> pretty religious sounding, with some guy talking in a very deep 
mono tone. I 
> don't have time to try to sort that BS out, and I am not impressed 
with 
> supposed spiritual revelations.  Ya reach a point after 40 years 
of reading, 
> and other sources, that you develope pretty good BS detectors. I 
got 
> interested in paranormal stuff when I was 13.
> 
> I also get the flickering lights, and thumps in the walls, but 
nothing ever 
> burns up, or stops working, except from normal failure.
> 
> Frank-S
